channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: Protesters defy Taliban intimidation
item.description: Demonstrators are on the streets again as pictures emerge showing injuries inflicted on journalists.

item.title: Australia may cancel Afghanistan Test if women banned
item.description: Cricket Australia (CA) will cancel its men's Test match with Afghanistan if reports that the women's team cannot play under Taliban rule are true.

item.title: International Space Station: Smoke triggers alert on board
item.description: The alarm went off as the space station's batteries were being charged, Russia's space agency says.

item.title: North Macedonia: Deadly fire guts Covid hospital
item.description: Fourteen people are killed at a makeshift hospital treating Covid-19 patients in Tetovo.

item.title: Jerome Boateng: German football star on trial over assault charge
item.description: Jerome Boateng is accused of injuring his ex-girlfriend during a dispute on holiday in 2018.

item.title: Lebanon: A country plunged into darkness
item.description: Lebanon’s ongoing crisis has plunged the country into darkness, with some experiencing power cuts for 20 hours a day.

item.title: North Korea: Military parade features hazmat suits, gas masks
item.description: Their inclusion may be a sign that a special force was created to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Covid: Sydney reveals plan to end months-long lockdown
item.description: Australia's biggest city is likely to exit lockdown from next month, provided vaccinations continue.

item.title: China offers $31m in emergency aid to Afghanistan
item.description: Taliban officials had earlier described China as Afghanistan's most important partner.

item.title: US Open 2021: Novak Djokovic will face Alexander Zverev in semi-final
item.description: Novak Djokovic will continue his bid to win all four Grand Slams in the same year against Olympic champion Alexander Zverev in Friday's US Open semi-final.

item.title: Respect: Jennifer Hudson on embodying soul legend Aretha Franklin
item.description: The singer was personally selected by soul legend Franklin to play her in the new biopic Respect.

item.title: Afghanistan: Women beaten for demanding their rights
item.description: Women in Afghanistan demanding their rights say they have been beaten by the Taliban.

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: Why people in Eswatini are protesting
item.description: Eswatini is Africa’s last absolute monarchy, which means the king controls everything.

item.title: The Kenyans who are helping the world to cheat
item.description: Some Kenyans try to escape poverty by helping foreign students to fake their academic work.

item.title: Paris attacks: Historic day of reckoning for night of terror
item.description: Survivors and families attend the long-awaited trial of 20 men accused of the deadly 2015 attacks.

item.title: Mexico earthquake: Lights seen in sky during tremor near Acapulco
item.description: The magnitude-seven quake struck the country's Pacific coast, near the resort of Acapulco.

item.title: Taliban fire shots to disperse protest in Kabul
item.description: Hundreds of protesters took to the streets on Tuesday to demand women's rights and denounce Taliban rule.

item.title: Australian bush rescue: Mother's reunion with boy lost for four days
item.description: Three-year-old Anthony "AJ" Elfalak is recovering with family after going missing for four days.

item.title: Mexico: Flash flooding sweeps away cars after heavy rain
item.description: Heavy rain in central Mexico sparked flash floods in Ecatepec and Nexahualcóyotl.

item.title: Esports: Why are there so few professional women gamers?
item.description: There are no female players in the top 300 earners in esports, according to research shared with BBC News.

item.title: Afghan Special Forces commander faced race against time to flee
item.description: An Afghan Special Forces commander says he owes his life to members of the Parachute Regiment who helped him escape.

item.title: Afghanistan: Could Pakistani drones hit the Panjshir Valley?
item.description: There are claims that Pakistan has used drones against anti-Taliban forces in Afghanistan.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

item.title: Taliban need UN's humanitarian aid - UN boss
item.description: In return, the new regime must provide conditions for the UN to work in Afghanistan, secretary general tells BBC.

item.title: The Taliban embrace social media: 'We too want to change perceptions'
item.description: Famed for their shunning of technology, the Taliban are realising they need to be on social media too.
